channel.title: Assassin's Creed: Revelations
channel.description:
Featuring Ezio, a few levels of Altair and the usual involvement from Desmond. Set in Constantinople.
Magazine scans: [url]https://gamenyusu.com/component/content/article/8-all-news/452-assassins-creed-revelations-scans.html[/url]
How do you feel?

item.title: Assassin's Creed: Revelations
item.dc:creator: Kairouseki
item.description:
I don’t even think they’d try anyway. Assassin’s Creed is more of an action game than Hitman is.

Read full topic

item.title: Assassin's Creed: Revelations
item.dc:creator: CTID
item.description:
No one can ever do a Hitman game right except the Hitman developers. Everyone else would be wise to not try.

Read full topic

item.title: Assassin's Creed: Revelations
item.dc:creator: k3nny1550
item.description:
There should be a mix of both. A good assassin weighs all options available and picks the one that’s both most effective and least likely to attract attention. Watch, they’ll add kills to make it look like an accident and we’ll have the next “Hitman” game.

Read full topic

item.title: Assassin's Creed: Revelations
item.dc:creator: Ibanez
item.description:
They better not make Desmond be a normal modern assassin with sniper rifles n shit. He better be that badass that still uses hidden blades in the 21st century. :awesome:

Read full topic

item.title: Assassin's Creed: Revelations
item.dc:creator: k3nny1550
item.description:
Doesn’t mean he can’t train. Or bleeding effect an ancestor that was a professional assassin in the '60s or something. Maybe one of his ancestors was the Grassy Knoll shooter or something.

Read full topic

item.title: Assassin's Creed: Revelations
item.dc:creator: Winged_One
item.description:
Desmond has experienced the bleeding effect with melee weapons, throwing knives, and primitive pistols. He’s probably a master at beating the shit out of someone with a lead pipe or making Julian-style people fries, while remaining a shit shot.

Read full topic

item.title: Assassin's Creed: Revelations
item.dc:creator: k3nny1550
item.description:
That would be kind of interesting. Using Parkour to get to a spot, and then a sniper rifle to take someone down at long range. Of course, all the melee combat that is the hallmark of the series would essentially have to be thrown out. Perhaps they’d use assets from the original version of Splinter Cell Conviction with crowd blends and the ability to use objects in the environment?

Read full topic

item.title: Assassin's Creed: Revelations
item.dc:creator: Ibanez
item.description:
All I want is assassins creed in modern day. Like, Prototype but less retardedly overpowered. How long will they delay that?

Read full topic

item.title: Assassin's Creed: Revelations
item.dc:creator: Kairouseki
item.description:
Ninjas are too cliche. And there’s already enough ninja games out there.

item.title: Assassin's Creed: Revelations
item.dc:creator: Winged_One
item.description:
CTID:

Looks like Ubisoft is going to milk the Ass Creed teet until it shrivels up and falls off. The series has been around for like 3-4 years and already there’s like 7 games.

EDIT: My mistake, there’s 9.

Yes, but the milk they always juice from the tit of the series is the sweetest tit milk you will ever taste.

Read full topic

item.title: Assassin's Creed: Revelations
item.dc:creator: TheKeeper
item.description:
This is great news. Although I’m sure we can already expect the PC version to be delayed by the routine few months. I gotta say, AC: Brotherhood’s ending reminded of episode 2’s in terms of the twist and goodness. Not to mention the superb voice acting. After the cliffhanger ending I just want to know what happens next.

Read full topic

item.title: Assassin's Creed: Revelations
item.dc:creator: k3nny1550
item.description:
I can’t wait. Brotherhood was my favorite of the series- the combat mechanics finally had some teeth, the game’s multiplayer rocked- it was just awesome. The plot felt a bit more extraneous to the action than Assassin’s Creed 2 did, but hopefully Revelations will bring the plot front and center again.

It takes a hell of a lot of work to put together a conspiracy yarn spanning multiple centuries. (I would know, because I’ve tried to write conspiracy yarns. And those didn’t even cover decades.) Let’s hope it pays off in the latest installment.

Read full topic
